security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate GitHub workflow automation skill with helper scripts using gh CLI and git commands. All 111 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES: (1) 'Weak cryptographic algorithm' flags JWT references in documentation - JWT is a token format, not an algorithm. (2) 'External commands' in markdown are documentation examples, not code. (3) subprocess calls use hardcoded argument lists with no user input, preventing injection. (4) Shell command substitution uses static commands for CI/status queries. No credential access, exfiltration, or malicious intent detected.

content.user_title: Review pull requests with automated quality gates
content.value_statement: Managing pull requests manually wastes time and creates inconsistent reviews. This skill automates PR creation, runs quality gates, and provides structured reviews to ensure every merge meets team standards.
actual_capabilities: Create well-formed pull requests with titles, descriptions, and issue links
Run automated quality gates checking CI status, coverage, security, and size
Perform comprehensive code reviews with checklist-based analysis
Auto-label PRs by type, scope, and size based on content
Auto-assign reviewers using CODEOWNERS and file path heuristics
Recommend merge strategies based on commit history and team preferences
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installed and authenticated
Does not execute code or make decisions without user approval
Cannot access private repositories without proper gh authentication
Quality gates provide suggestions, final review decisions remain with human reviewers

use_cases.title: Streamlined PR Creation
use_cases.description: Generate professional PRs with proper titles, descriptions, and linked issues in seconds

use_cases.title: Consistent Quality Standards
use_cases.description: Enforce team quality gates across all PRs with automated checks and standardized reviews

use_cases.title: CI/CD Integration
use_cases.description: Monitor CI pipeline status and sync PR progress with project boards automatically

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review PR #123 on this repository. Check the quality gates and provide a summary of any issues found.

prompt_templates.title: Create PR
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate a pull request for changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pull request for my branch feature/user-auth. Generate a title from the commits and create a description.

prompt_templates.title: Quality Check
prompt_templates.scenario: Run all quality gates on a PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the full quality gate check on PR #456. Report on CI status, test coverage, security scan, and PR size.

prompt_templates.title: Merge Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze PR #789 and recommend the best merge strategy. Consider the commit history and provide reasoning.

output_examples.input: Review PR #123 and check quality gates
output: PR #123: feat(auth): add JWT token authentication
Test Coverage: Tests included (95% new code coverage)
Merge recommendation: Squash and merge for clean history

output_examples.input: Create PR for my feature branch
output: Suggested title: feat(payments): add Stripe integration

best_practices: Always run quality gates before requesting human review to catch obvious issues early
Use conventional commit format in PR titles for automatic type detection and labeling
Link related issues using Closes or Related keywords to maintain traceability
anti_patterns: Merging PRs without checking CI status or running quality gates
Creating large PRs over 400 LOC that are hard to review effectively
Skipping PR descriptions or using generic titles like fix or updates

faq.question: Does this skill require GitHub CLI installation
faq.answer: Yes, the gh CLI must be installed and authenticated. Run gh auth login to set up.

faq.question: Can this skill approve PRs automatically
faq.answer: No, the skill provides recommendations and analysis. Final approval decisions remain with human reviewers.

faq.question: What quality gates are checked
faq.answer: Five gates: CI/CD status, test coverage, code quality scores, security scan, and PR size limits.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere
faq.answer: No, all operations use gh CLI locally. Code diffs are processed locally and never sent to external services.

faq.question: Does this work with GitHub Enterprise
faq.answer: Yes, gh CLI supports GitHub Enterprise Server. Configure with gh auth login using your enterprise URL.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHubs built-in reviews
faq.answer: This skill provides additional automation including quality gates, auto-labeling, and merge strategy advice beyond basic GitHub review features.
